trans-unit.target: TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> A troubled taxonomist is having second thoughts.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_TODO_00<tab>Show the yellow pansy concept to people around Poieten Oikos and ask their opinions.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_TODO_01<tab>Deliver the Ktisis Hyperboreia guidebook and the yellow pansy concept to the troubled taxonomist.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_000<tab>Perfect timing, familiar. I have a favor to ask of you.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_001<tab>It's my job to name the creations brought to us, but I can't seem to decide on one for this particular concept.

TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_002<tab>It may be because...I'm the one who designed it. It's a species of plant which I intended as a gift for my love. A clear conflict of interest, unfortunately.

TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_003<tab>My names are always fair and logical and perfectly suited to the creation. But this time, I'm not so sure. I do have a name for it, but what if it's...not suitable? What if it's too personal?

TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_004<tab>I thought of discussing the matter with my associates, but my dilemma is far too embarrassing. Would you ask if they think the name is appropriate in my stead? Don't worry─I wouldn't expect you to work without recompense.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_005<tab>This is the creation. A yellow pansy. And the name I have in mind is “mythos.”
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_008<tab>Please ask around and see what people think of the name of my new flower.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_LAMPITO_000_010<tab>Yes, what is it?
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_LAMPITO_000_011<tab>My, what a pretty flower. And you said it was called “mythos”? A fine name.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_LAMPITO_000_012<tab>Many flowers are named with a special feeling in mind, so going by what you've told me, this one is in good company.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_013<tab>A familiar? Do you need something?
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_014<tab>A flower? It's beautiful! And it smells so lovely. Is it for me?
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_015<tab>...Oh. You just want to know if the name is suitable, do you?
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_016<tab>Have you tried asking at Ktisis Hyperboreia? No one knows as much about naming as them.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_017<tab>Here's a guidebook on the subject. Take it with you, and let your master decide what to do from there.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_LAMPITO_000_020<tab>That flower was clearly named with love. I think it's wonderful.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_GLAPHYRA_000_021<tab>Take that guidebook to your master and see if they want to confer with one of the experts at Ktisis.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_030<tab>How did it go? What did everyone think of the name?
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_031<tab>I see... Well, that is good to know. I won't be needing this guidebook, of course, as I can't very well ask myself for my thoughts.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_032<tab>Or perhaps I should. It wouldn't hurt to have some confidence in the work I do, after all.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_033<tab>As I created this flower, I thought of my beloved, an artist, and the stories she seeks to tell through her plays.
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_034<tab>My hope is that, much like a myth or legend, her work is told and retold down through the ages. Hence, “mythos.”
TEXT_AKTKZH009_04304_NAMER04304_000_035<tab>I've decided. I'll keep the name and submit it to the Bureau of the Architect. Thank you for your help.
